body: Hi @glentakahashi. Can you list where `builtinredis` and `hex-python-kernel` can be found? Are these chart dependencies that are already part of the chart, or are they fetched elsewhere? I noticed that both do not list a repository.
hey @bacongobbler yea those are inlined charts that are committed with our repo. They're in the charts directory

Doh, I think this was my fault. I think it's specifically when https://github.com/helm/helm/blob/82f739072cb3c94f26e3103e4524a1f74526342d/pkg/downloader/manager.go#L170-L180 was added. The function `ensureMissingRepos` doesn't skip missing repos.

We should try to get this in to 3.4.1 which is set to be released on November 11.

Sorry about this one.

issue.body:
A previous update to automate finding charts in repos when update
was run did not take into account the case for no repo being
specified. This fixes that situation.

Closes #8940

issue.title: how to correctly configure local sub charts with Helm >= 3.4.0
issue.body:
Given a chart with two subcharts with the following structure

```
charts/
 + local-subchart
 + fetched-subchart
Chart.yaml
```
I am not sure how the `dependencies` section in the `Chart.yaml` should look like. 
Up to Helm < 3.4.0 I used
```
dependencies:
  - name: "fetched-subchart"
    version: "1.2.3"
    repository: "@my-repo"
```
simply ignoring the local-subchart, which should not be fetched from any repo. 
Now, Helm 3.4.0 complains when linting this chart.
```
chart metadata is missing these dependencies: local-subchart
``` 

So I added this chart to the dependencies, giving
```
dependencies:
  - name: "local-subchart"
    version: "1.2.3"
  - name: "fetched-subchart"
    version: "1.2.3"
    repository: "@my-repo"
```

This fixes the linting. However, running `helm dependency update` gives an error: 

```
Getting updates for unmanaged Helm repositories...
Error: could not find protocol handler for: 
```

So I am a bit confused. What is the proposed way of configuring subcharts? 

The docs in https://helm.sh/docs/chart_template_guide/subcharts_and_globals/#creating-a-subchart might need some updates on this as well. 

Output of `helm version`:

version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.4.0", GitCommit:"7090a89efc8a18f3d8178bf47d2462450349a004", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.14.10"}

issue.title: [cetic/nifi] Calling `helm dep up`  when installing chart from local clone fails
issue.body:
<!-- Thanks for filing an issue! Before hitting the button, please answer these questions. It's helpful to search the existing GitHub issues first. It's likely that another user has already reported the issue you're facing, or it's a known issue that we're already aware of 

Fill in as much of the template below as you can.  If you leave out information, we can't help you as well.

Be ready for followup questions, and please respond in a timely manner. If we can't reproduce a bug or think a feature already exists, we might close your issue.  If we're wrong, PLEASE feel free to reopen it and explain why.
-->

**Describe the bug**
When cloning the repo and trying to call `helm dependency update`, get the following error:
```
Getting updates for unmanaged Helm repositories...
Error: could not find protocol handler for:
```
It looks like helm doesn't like that no repository is specified for `ca` in Chart.yml dependencies, even though the subchart is already in `charts/`. Commenting out the `ca` dependency and then calling `helm dependency update` will allow the other dependencies to be downloaded into `charts/`.

**Version of Helm and Kubernetes**:
Helm Version: v3.4.0

**What happened**:


**What you expected to happen**:


**How to reproduce it** (as minimally and precisely as possible):
Follow the install steps:
```
git clone https://github.com/cetic/helm-nifi.git nifi
cd nifi
helm repo add incubator https://kubernetes-charts-incubator.storage.googleapis.com
helm repo update
helm dep up
```


**Anything else we need to know**:
Simply installing the helm chart via `helm install my-release cetic/nifi` works fine, but I'm looking to customize the chart.

issue.title: Uses deprecated https://kubernetes-charts.storage.googleapis.com as default repository

repository.name: helm-maven-plugin
repository.description: Simple plugin to package helm charts

issue.body:
With version (5.5 and) 5.6, using helm 3.4.0, I get this error message:
```
[INFO] --- helm-maven-plugin:5.6:init (default-init) @ MC-integration ---
[INFO] Initializing Helm...
[INFO] Using local HELM binary [/usr/sbin/helm]
[INFO] Adding default repo [stable]
[ERROR] Error: repo "https://kubernetes-charts.storage.googleapis.com" is no longer available; try "https://charts.helm.sh/stable" instead
```

Now, that is an error message rather than a warning because of [a helm issue #8940](https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/8940), I think. However, `helm-maven-plugin` should no longer be using that repository. I see that the repository name is in `src/main/java/com/kiwigrid/helm/maven/plugin/InitMojo.java`, method `InitMojo.execute`, and is used only if the `helm.init.add-default-repo` property is `true`, which is its default value.

issue.title: Update Helm 3 because of Helm Bug helm/helm#8940

milestone.title: v1.8
milestone.description: Bug fixes, scaling ArgoCD to support 2000+ apps and 100+ clusters, integration with ArgoCD notifications

issue.body:
If a Chart dependency doesn't specify a repository Helm 3.4.0 fails with "Error: could not find protocol handler for:" -> update Helm to 3.4.1 which fixes https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/8940.

**Version**
1.8.0-rc1

**Logs**

```
time="2020-11-26T10:49:09Z" level=error msg="`helm dependency build` failed exit status 1: Error: could not find protocol handler for:" execID=HSuXQ
```

issue.title: Outdated helm version used in jx-preview:0.0.138

repository.name: jx
repository.description: Jenkins X provides automated CI+CD for Kubernetes with Preview Environments on Pull Requests using Cloud Native pipelines from Tekton

issue.body:
### Summary
The helm version that is used in the gcr.io/jenkinsxio/jx-preview:0.0.138 image is outdated (3.4.0) and therefore subject to the following issue: https://github.com/helm/helm/issues/8940

#### Recommended Fix
Update gcr.io/jenkinsxio/jx-preview to use the newest version of Helm (3.4.2 at the time of creating this issue).
